  ', 'Your codespace will open once ready.', 'There was a problem preparing your codespace, please try again.', 'Starting with spaCy v3.2, alternate loggers are moved into a separate package
so that they can be added and updated independently from the core spaCy
library.', ' currently provides loggers for:', ' also provides additional utility loggers to facilitate interoperation
between individual loggers.', "If you'd like to add a new logger or logging option, please submit a PR to this
repo!", " should be installed automatically with spaCy v3.2+, so you
usually don't need to install it separately. You can install it with ", ' or
from the conda channel ', ':', 'This logger requires ', ' to be installed and configured:', ' is a logger that sends the results of each training step
to the dashboard of the ', ' tool. To use
this logger, Weights & Biases should be installed, and you should be logged in.
The logger will send the full config file to W&B, as well as various system
information such as memory utilization, network traffic, disk IO, GPU
statistics, etc. This will also include information such as your hostname and
operating system, as well as the location of your Python executable.', ' and below automatically call the ', '.
However, starting with ', ', console logging must be activated
through the use of the ', ". This allows the user to configure
the console logger's parameters according to their preferences.", ' that by default, the full (interpolated)
', ' is sent over to the
W&B dashboard. If you prefer to ', ' such as path
names, you can list those fields in "dot notation" in the
', ' parameter. These fields will then be removed from the
config before uploading, but will otherwise remain in the config file stored
on your local system.', 'This logger requires ', ' to be installed and configured:', ' is a logger that tracks the results of each training step
using the ', ' tool. To use
this logger, MLflow should be installed. At the beginning of each model training
operation, the logger will initialize a new MLflow run and set it as the active
run under which metrics and parameters wil be logged. The logger will then log
the entire config file as parameters of the active run. After each training step,
the following actions are performed:', 'By default, the tracking API writes data into files in a local ', ' directory.', ' and below automatically call the ', '.
However, starting with ', ', console logging must be activated
through the use of the ', ". This allows the user to configure
the console logger's parameters according to their preferences.", ' that by default, the full (interpolated)
', ' is sent over to
MLflow. If you prefer to ', ' such as path
names, you can list those fields in "dot notation" in the
', ' parameter. These fields will then be removed from the
config before uploading, but will otherwise remain in the config file stored
on your local system.', 'This logger requires ', ' to be installed and configured:', ' is a logger that tracks the results of each training step
using the ', ' tool. To use
this logger, ClearML should be installed and you should have initialized (using the command above).
The logger will send all the gathered information to your ClearML server, either ', '
or the open source ', '. This logger captures the following information, all of which is visible in the ClearML web UI:', 'In addition to the above, the following artifacts can also be optionally captured:', ' and below automatically call the ', '.
However, starting with ', ', console logging must be activated
through the use of the ', ". This allows the user to configure
the console logger's parameters according to their preferences.", ' that by default, the full (interpolated)
', ' is sent over to
ClearML. If you prefer to ', ' such as path
names, you can list those fields in "dot notation" in the
', ' parameter. These fields will then be removed from the
config before uploading, but will otherwise remain in the config file stored
on your local system.', 'This logger requires ', ' to be installed:', " is different from the other loggers above in that it does not act as a bridge between spaCy and
an external framework. Instead, it is used to query PyTorch-specific metrics and make them available to other loggers.
Therefore, it's primarily intended to be used with ", '.', 'Whenever a logging checkpoint is reached, it queries statistics from the PyTorch backend and stores them in
the dictionary passed to it. Downstream loggers can thereafter lookup the statistics and log them to their
preferred framework.', 'The following PyTorch statistics are currently supported:', 'This logger requires ', ' to be installed:', 'Similar to ', ', ', ' does not act as a bridge between spaCy and an external framework
but rather is used with the ', ' to facilitate the flow of metrics to other loggers.
The ', ' queries statistics from the CuPy backend and stores them in the info dictionary passed to it. Downstream
loggers can thereafter lookup the statistics and log them to their preferred framework.', 'The following CuPy statistics are currently supported:', 'This logger can be used to daisy-chain multiple loggers and execute them in-order. Loggers that are executed earlier in the chain
can pass information to those that come later by adding it to the dictionary that is passed to them.', 'Currently, up to 10 loggers can be chained together.', 'This logger can be used to lookup statistics in the info dictionary and print them to ', '. It is primarily
intended to be used as a tool when developing new loggers.', 'Please use ', ' to report a bug, or open a new thread on the
', '
for any other issue.', '
